content.description:
Climb the large, brown flake feature at the bottom of the wall to a nice stance at its top.

Move slightly left from here, then straight up, through cruxy terrain for a few clips.

Hang on through fantastic 5.11 pocket pulling, over perfect stone to reach the anchor.

Begin just right of a crumbly crack system on the left side of the main wall.

A reachy and difficult start on somewhat crumbly terrain leads to more small pockets and edges as the difficulty eases toward the anchor.
content.location: Left of the route 'Upernavik',on the left side of the main wall.

content.description:
This route sits by itself on the short clean wall to the left of the main wall.

Climb over nice white stone using sharp black pockets.

Long reaches on decent holds leads to the anchor.
content.location: Left of the route 'Omenak', on the short detached wall left of the main routes.

content.description:
A short but fun, sustained, and powerful line. It looks pretty hard from below but there are actually some pretty good positive pockets that make the route go, although they are somewhat far apart making for some big moves.

Start at the seam in a good fingerlock/pod. Work your way up the tan colored, compact limestone face, using a variety of pockets and crimps. This climb overhangs gently at the start then turns slabby at the last bolt.
content.location: One of the leftmost routes at Greenland. It's to the left of a massive corner such that the wall right of the corner has many bolted routes on it. It is identifiable by a gently overhanging, compact, tan colored limestone face with a seam at the bottom that eventually peters out, and the seam had a good fingerlock pod as the start hold.

content.description:
This route climbs the arete and face just left of the 'Ice Breaker' corner.

Start on the face just right of the arete, eventually moving left through the crux at mid height, onto the left side of the arete to gain the anchor.

Fantastic movement and perfect stone for the entire length.
content.location:
Between 'Upernavik' and 'Ice Breaker'.

The obvious prow/arete feature.

content.description: Is still a little crumbly - be careful when belaying.

This line takes the obvious corner on the right side of the main wall routes.

Climb the corner using big pockets and solid laybacks on great rock all the way to the anchor.
content.protection: 7 or 8 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor
content.location: The obvious bolted corner/crack feature. Just right of the route 'Narsaq'.

content.description: Some reachy pockets and gastons at the start culminate with a double two finger pocket crux launch for a good jug.   Don't relax yet, this five bolt ride isn't over until you clip the chains.  A little slice of Wild Iris in Ten Sleep.
content.location: The short wall you pass on the left before you arrive at the main crag. Second bolted line from the left.

content.description: Climb the first pitch of Inuit Flake on 10d terrain, get a good no hands rest, take the right route of bolts, then punch through the head wall with big moves on good holds. Recommend skipping the last bolt of Inuit Flake and back cleaning the anchor. Putting an alpine draw on the first bolt of Design Model will also reduce drag and make it easier to clip from the rest.
content.location: The 2nd to last line on the Greenland area
